Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Newly \New"ly\, adv. 1. Lately; recently. [1913 Webster]
He rubbed it o'er with newly gathered mint. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. Anew; afresh; freshly. [1913 Webster]
And the refined mind doth newly fashion Into a fairer form. --Spenser. [1913 Webster]

newly adv : very recently; "they are newly married"; "newly raised objections"; "a newly arranged hairdo"; "grass new washed by the rain"; "a freshly cleaned floor"; "we are fresh out of tomatoes" [syn: {recently}, {freshly}, {fresh}, {new}]
